underlying_goal: To conduct a comprehensive research project on statutory interpretation frameworks in common law jurisdictions, with the aim of developing a novel descriptive framework.
friction_detail: The multi-model pipeline had some partial failures in the red-teaming phase, but the core divergence and synthesis phases worked, providing sufficient material to achieve the goal.
primary_success: Successfully orchestrating a complex, multi-agent research strategy, combining iterative user interviews, parallel LLM brainstorming, and targeted literature/case-law review to produce a novel, convergent research thesis (the 'Switch-Point' architecture).
brief_summary: The user initiated a research project on statutory interpretation. Claude first used an interview skill to clarify the project's scope and goals. It then launched a large-scale, parallel research effort involving literature review, case law analysis, and multi-model brainstorming, ultimately synthesizing the findings into a novel 'Switch-Point' architectural thesis and a clear set of next steps.
